Data Structures

struct  Node

Detailed Description

Allows to iterate over all compound items of a multimedia editor document.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CompoundItemIterator::CompoundItemIterator (  const MultiMediaEditorDocument *  doc  ) 
 

Provides the iterator with the document and automatically sets the iterator to the begin.

CompoundItemIterator::~CompoundItemIterator (   )  [virtual]
 

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN CompoundItemIterator::Begin (   ) 
 

Resets the iterator to the begin of the document. CompoundItem::Get returns the first compound item if CompoundItemIterator::Begin returned TRUE. Use CompoundItemIterator::Next for moving the iterator to the next item.

Returns:
FALSE is returned, if the document contains no compound items.

const CompoundItem * CompoundItemIterator::Get (  INT *  start_index = 0  )  const
 

Returns a pointer to the current compound item. 0 is only returned, if CompoundItemIterator::Begin or CompoundItemIterator::Next returned 0.

Parameters:
start_index Optional output parameter which contains the start item index of the compound item in relation to the document.

BOOLEAN CompoundItemIterator::Next (   ) 
 

Sets the iterator to the next compound item of the document. The current compound item can be retrieved by CompoundItemIterator::Get.

Returns:
FALSE is returned, if no next compound item exists.
